text: A banana is a yellow fruit that is soft and sweet.
A lemon is yellow and very sour.
A chili pepper is red and extremely spicy.
An apple can be red, green, or yellow and has a sweet taste.
Biryani is a flavorful Indian rice dish made with spices, rice, and usually meat or vegetables.
Samosa is a fried or baked pastry with a spicy potato filling, popular as a snack in India.
Paneer butter masala is a creamy tomato-based curry made with Indian cottage cheese.
Masala dosa is a thin, crispy fermented crepe filled with spicy mashed potatoes.
Chole is a spicy chickpea curry from North India, often eaten with rice or bhature.
Rasgulla is a spongy dessert made from ball-shaped dumplings of chhena cooked in light syrup.
Naan is a soft and fluffy flatbread that is traditionally baked in a tandoor.
Tandoori chicken is chicken marinated in yogurt and spices, roasted in a tandoor.
Gulab jamun is a deep-fried milk-solid ball soaked in sweet syrup, served as dessert.
Pav bhaji is a spicy vegetable mash served with soft buttered buns.
Raita is a yogurt-based condiment that cools down spicy dishes.
Dhokla is a soft and fluffy savory cake made from fermented rice and chickpea flour.
Butter chicken is a rich tomato gravy dish with tender pieces of marinated chicken.
Lassi is a cold yogurt drink blended with sugar, salt, or fruits like mango.
Dal tadka is a spiced lentil curry tempered with cumin, mustard seeds, and curry leaves.
Jalebi is a sweet Indian dessert made by deep-frying flour batter in spiral shapes and soaking in sugar syrup.
Peking duck is a famous Beijing dish featuring crispy roasted duck served with pancakes, hoisin sauce, and scallions.
Kung Pao chicken is a spicy stir-fry dish made with chicken, peanuts, vegetables, and chili peppers.
Mapo tofu is a Sichuan dish featuring soft tofu in a spicy chili and bean-based sauce, typically with minced pork.
Xiao long bao are Chinese soup dumplings filled with meat and hot broth, typically served in a bamboo steamer.
Chow mein is a stir-fried noodle dish made with vegetables and sometimes meat or seafood.
Hot and sour soup is a Chinese soup made with mushrooms, tofu, bamboo shoots, and egg, flavored with vinegar and white pepper.
Dim sum refers to a variety of small Chinese dishes served with tea, including dumplings, buns, and rolls.
Mooncake is a traditional Chinese pastry filled with lotus seed paste or red bean, eaten during the Mid-Autumn Festival.
Sweet and sour pork is a Chinese dish with crispy pork pieces in a tangy sauce with pineapple and peppers.
Ma la hot pot is a spicy Sichuan-style Chinese hot pot with numbing mala spices.
Sushi is a Japanese dish of vinegared rice combined with seafood, vegetables, and sometimes tropical fruits.
Ramen is a Japanese noodle soup dish with Chinese-style wheat noodles served in a meat or fish-based broth.
Tempura is a Japanese dish of seafood or vegetables that have been battered and deep-fried.
Miso soup is a traditional Japanese soup consisting of a stock called dashi into which softened miso paste is mixed.
Okonomiyaki is a savory Japanese pancake containing a variety of ingredients.
Yakitori is grilled chicken skewers with tare sauce, a popular Japanese street food.
Udon is a type of thick wheat flour noodle served hot or cold in Japanese cuisine.
Takoyaki are ball-shaped Japanese snacks made of wheat flour batter and cooked with octopus pieces.
Mochi is a Japanese rice cake made from glutinous rice pounded into paste and molded.
Tonkatsu is a Japanese dish of breaded, deep-fried pork cutlet served with shredded cabbage.
Kimchi is a traditional Korean side dish made from fermented vegetables, usually cabbage and radish, with chili pepper and garlic.
Bibimbap is a Korean mixed rice dish topped with sautéed vegetables, sliced meat, a fried egg, and chili paste.
Tteokbokki is a popular Korean street food made of chewy rice cakes in a spicy red sauce.
Bulgogi is a Korean grilled marinated beef dish that is sweet and savory.
Samgyeopsal is Korean grilled pork belly served with lettuce wraps and various side dishes.
Japchae is a Korean stir-fried dish made with sweet potato noodles, vegetables, and sometimes meat.
Korean fried chicken is crispy chicken with a sweet and spicy glaze, often served with pickled radish.
Sundubu jjigae is a Korean soft tofu stew with seafood, vegetables, and spicy broth.
Hotteok is a Korean sweet pancake filled with brown sugar, honey, chopped peanuts, and cinnamon.
Makgeolli is a traditional Korean alcoholic beverage made from rice, wheat, or barley.
Pad Thai is a stir-fried noodle dish with shrimp, peanuts, and tamarind sauce, one of Thailand's national dishes.
Tom Yum is a hot and sour Thai soup made with shrimp, lemongrass, and lime juice.
Green curry is a spicy Thai curry made with green chilies, coconut milk, and Thai basil.
Massaman curry is a rich, sweet Thai curry with Persian influences, often made with beef or chicken.
Som tam is a spicy Thai salad made from shredded green papaya, tomatoes, and peanuts.
Mango sticky rice is a traditional Thai dessert made with glutinous rice, fresh mango slices, and coconut milk.
Pad kra pao is a Thai stir-fry dish with minced meat, Thai basil, and chilies, served over rice.
Tom kha gai is a creamy Thai coconut chicken soup with galangal, lemongrass, and lime leaves.
Thai iced tea is a sweet, creamy beverage made from strongly brewed tea, sugar, and condensed milk.
Larb is a spicy Thai meat salad made with minced pork or beef, herbs, and lime juice.
Pho is a Vietnamese noodle soup consisting of broth, rice noodles, herbs, and meat.
Banh mi is a Vietnamese sandwich made with a French baguette filled with various meats, vegetables, and sauces.
Spring rolls are fresh Vietnamese rolls made with rice paper, filled with shrimp, herbs, and vegetables.
Bun cha is a Vietnamese dish of grilled pork and noodles served with dipping sauce and fresh herbs.
Cao lau is a Vietnamese noodle dish from Hoi An with thick noodles, pork, and crispy wontons.
Vietnamese coffee is a strong coffee served with condensed milk, often over ice.
Bánh xèo is a Vietnamese savory pancake made with rice flour, coconut milk, and turmeric.
Hu tieu is a Vietnamese noodle soup with pork, seafood, and a clear broth.
Com tam is Vietnamese broken rice served with grilled pork, egg, and pickled vegetables.
Che ba mau is a Vietnamese dessert with layers of beans, jelly, and coconut milk over ice.
Nasi Goreng is Indonesian-style fried rice often cooked with kecap manis, garlic, shallots, and chili.
Rendang is a spicy meat dish slow-cooked in coconut milk and spices, originating from Indonesia.
Satay is Indonesian grilled meat skewers served with peanut sauce.
Gado-gado is an Indonesian salad of mixed vegetables served with peanut sauce.
Mie ayam is Indonesian chicken noodle soup with yellow noodles and seasoned chicken.
Gudeg is a traditional Indonesian sweet stew made from young jackfruit with palm sugar and coconut milk.
Soto ayam is an Indonesian chicken soup with turmeric, served with rice and various condiments.
Bakso is Indonesian meatball soup served with noodles and vegetables in a savory broth.
Martabak is Indonesian stuffed pancake with either sweet or savory fillings.
Es cendol is an Indonesian dessert drink made with rice flour jelly, coconut milk, and palm sugar syrup.
Nasi lemak is Malaysia's national dish consisting of fragrant rice cooked in coconut milk, served with sambal, anchovies, and egg.
Char kway teow is a Malaysian stir-fried flat rice noodle dish with soy sauce, prawns, and bean sprouts.
Laksa is a spicy Malaysian noodle soup with coconut milk and curry or tamarind broth.
Hainanese chicken rice is a Malaysian dish of poached chicken served with fragrant rice.
Roti canai is a Malaysian flatbread served with curry or sugar, popular for breakfast.
Cendol is a Malaysian dessert with green rice flour jelly, coconut milk, and gula melaka.
Bak kut teh is a Malaysian pork rib soup cooked with herbs and spices.
Assam laksa is a sour, fish-based Malaysian soup noodle from Penang.
Teh tarik is Malaysian pulled tea made with black tea and condensed milk.
Kuih is a variety of Malaysian bite-sized snacks and desserts, often colorful and sweet.
Adobo is a Filipino dish made by marinating meat in vinegar, soy sauce, and garlic, then simmering it.
Halo-halo is a Filipino dessert made from crushed ice, evaporated milk, and mixed ingredients like sweet beans, fruits, and jellies.
Lechon is a Filipino roasted pig dish, often served during special occasions.
Sinigang is a Filipino sour soup made with tamarind, tomatoes, and various meats or seafood.
Lumpia is a Filipino spring roll filled with vegetables, meat, or seafood.
Pancit is a Filipino stir-fried noodle dish with vegetables and meat or seafood.
Bibingka is a Filipino rice cake traditionally eaten during Christmas season.
Kare-kare is a Filipino stew made with oxtail and vegetables in peanut sauce.
Balut is a Filipino delicacy of fertilized duck egg incubated and boiled.
Taho is a Filipino sweet snack made of soft tofu, arnibal syrup, and sago pearls.
Pasta carbonara is an Italian dish made with eggs, cheese, pancetta, and black pepper.
Risotto is a Northern Italian rice dish cooked with broth until it reaches a creamy consistency.
Pizza margherita is a traditional Neapolitan pizza topped with tomatoes, mozzarella, and fresh basil.
Gelato is Italian ice cream made with milk, sugar, and various flavorings, denser than regular ice cream.
Tiramisu is an Italian dessert made of ladyfingers dipped in coffee, layered with mascarpone and cocoa.
Osso buco is an Italian braised veal shanks dish cooked with vegetables, white wine, and broth.
Minestrone is a thick Italian soup made with vegetables, beans, and pasta or rice.
Parmigiana is an Italian dish of eggplant layered with cheese and tomato sauce, then baked.
Cannoli are Italian pastry desserts filled with sweet ricotta cheese and chocolate chips.
Antipasti is an Italian appetizer platter featuring cured meats, cheeses, olives, and vegetables.
Coq au vin is a French dish of chicken braised with wine, typically red wine from Burgundy.
Bouillabaisse is a traditional Provençal fish stew originating from the port city of Marseille.
Croissant is a buttery, flaky, viennoiserie pastry that originated in France.
Crème brûlée is a French dessert consisting of rich custard topped with caramelized sugar.
Ratatouille is a French stewed vegetable dish from Nice, made with eggplant, zucchini, and tomatoes.
French onion soup is a classic French soup made with caramelized onions and beef stock, topped with cheese.
Escargot is a French delicacy of cooked snails, typically prepared with garlic and parsley butter.
Boeuf bourguignon is a French beef stew braised in red wine with vegetables and herbs.
Macarons are French sandwich cookies made with almond flour, filled with ganache or buttercream.
Quiche Lorraine is a French savory tart with eggs, cream, and bacon baked in a pastry crust.
Paella is a Spanish rice dish originally from Valencia, cooked with saffron and various meats or seafood.
Tapas are a variety of small Spanish appetizers that can be served hot or cold.
Gazpacho is a cold Spanish soup made primarily from tomatoes, peppers, and cucumbers.
Jamón ibérico is a type of cured Spanish ham produced from free-range Iberian pigs.
Churros are Spanish fried-dough pastries dusted with cinnamon sugar, often served with chocolate.
Patatas bravas are Spanish fried potato cubes served with spicy tomato sauce and aioli.
Tortilla española is a Spanish omelet made with eggs, potatoes, and sometimes onions.
Fabada asturiana is a rich Spanish bean stew from Asturias with sausage and pork.
Flan is a Spanish caramel custard dessert with a layer of soft caramel on top.
Sangria is a Spanish alcoholic beverage made with red wine, chopped fruit, and sometimes brandy.
Fish and chips is a British dish of battered deep-fried fish served with chips (french fries).
Bangers and mash is a British dish of sausages served with mashed potatoes and onion gravy.
Shepherd's pie is a British dish made with minced lamb and vegetables topped with mashed potato.
Yorkshire pudding is a British baked pudding made from batter, traditionally served with roast beef.
Haggis is a traditional Scottish dish containing sheep's pluck mixed with onion, oatmeal, and spices.
Full English breakfast includes bacon, eggs, sausages, baked beans, toast, and grilled tomatoes.
Beef Wellington is a British dish of beef tenderloin coated with pâté and wrapped in puff pastry.
Sticky toffee pudding is a British dessert consisting of sponge cake with toffee sauce.
Cornish pasty is a British pastry filled with beef, vegetables, and gravy, originally from Cornwall.
Earl Grey tea is a British tea blend flavored with oil of bergamot.
Bratwurst is a German sausage made from pork or beef, typically grilled or pan-fried.
Sauerbraten is a traditional German roast of heavily marinated meat, usually beef.
Pretzel is a type of baked bread product made from dough twisted into a distinctive knot-like shape.
Black Forest cake is a German chocolate cake with cherries and whipped cream.
Schnitzel is a German breaded, pan-fried cutlet of meat, traditionally veal.
Sauerkraut is fermented cabbage commonly used as a German side dish or condiment.
Spätzle are German soft egg noodles, often served with cheese or as a side dish.
Currywurst is a German fast food dish of steamed, then fried pork sausage with curry ketchup.
Apfelstrudel is a German pastry filled with apples, sugar, cinnamon, and breadcrumbs.
German beer is brewed according to the Reinheitsgebot purity law, using only hops, malt, and water.
Tacos are a traditional Mexican dish consisting of a corn or wheat tortilla folded around a filling.
Guacamole is a Mexican avocado-based dip seasoned with lime juice, salt, and various spices.
Enchiladas are Mexican corn tortillas rolled around a filling and covered with a savory sauce.
Mole is a traditional Mexican sauce containing chocolate and various spices.
Quesadillas are Mexican tortillas filled with cheese and other ingredients, then grilled.
Pozole is a Mexican soup made with hominy, meat, and red or green chili pepper-based broth.
Tamales are Mexican steamed masa dough filled with meats, cheeses, or vegetables, wrapped in corn husks.
Ceviche is a Mexican dish of fresh raw fish marinated in citrus juices and spiced with chili peppers.
Tres leches cake is a Mexican sponge cake soaked in three kinds of milk.
Horchata is a Mexican sweet drink made from rice, cinnamon, and vanilla.
Hamburger is an American sandwich consisting of a cooked patty of ground meat in a sliced bun.
BBQ ribs are American-style pork ribs cooked low and slow with barbecue sauce.
Mac and cheese is an American dish of cooked macaroni pasta and cheese sauce.
Apple pie is a traditional American dessert with apple filling in a pastry crust.
Clam chowder is a thick American soup containing clams, vegetables, and cream or broth.
Hot dogs are American grilled or steamed sausages served in a sliced bun with various toppings.
Buffalo wings are American chicken wings coated in hot sauce and served with blue cheese dressing.
Pancakes are American flat cakes made from batter and cooked on a griddle, served with syrup.
Cheesecake is an American sweet dessert made with cream cheese on a graham cracker crust.
Coca-Cola is an American carbonated soft drink that originated in Atlanta, Georgia.
Poutine is a Canadian dish of french fries topped with cheese curds and brown gravy.
Maple syrup is a Canadian syrup made from the sap of maple trees, often used on pancakes.
Tourtière is a traditional French-Canadian meat pie typically served during holidays.
Butter tarts are Canadian pastries filled with butter, sugar, and eggs.
Montreal bagels are Canadian bagels that are smaller, denser, and sweeter than New York bagels.
Nanaimo bars are Canadian no-bake squares with a coconut base, custard middle, and chocolate top.
Split pea soup is a Canadian soup made from dried split peas, often with ham or bacon.
Bannock is traditional Canadian fried bread, originally made by Indigenous peoples.
Canadian bacon is back bacon that is sweet, lean, and typically served at breakfast.
Ice wine is a Canadian dessert wine produced from grapes that have been frozen while still on the vine.
Empanadas are Argentine baked or fried pastries filled with meat, cheese, or vegetables.
Asado is Argentine barbecue featuring various cuts of meat grilled over an open fire.
Dulce de leche is a sweet Argentine confection made by slowly heating milk and sugar.
Milanesa is an Argentine breaded cutlet dish similar to schnitzel, typically made with beef or chicken.
Chimichurri is an Argentine green sauce made with parsley, cilantro, garlic, and olive oil.
Choripán is an Argentine sandwich made with chorizo sausage in a crusty bread roll.
Locro is a hearty Argentine stew made with corn, beans, and meat, especially popular in winter.
Alfajores are Argentine sandwich cookies filled with dulce de leche and often covered in chocolate.
Provoleta is grilled provolone cheese served as an Argentine appetizer, often with herbs.
Malbec is a red wine variety that has become Argentina's signature wine grape.
Feijoada is a Brazilian stew of black beans with pork and sausage, served with rice.
Coxinha is a Brazilian snack of shredded chicken covered in dough, shaped into a teardrop and fried.
Açaí bowl is a Brazilian dish made from frozen açaí berries blended and served with toppings.
Brigadeiro is a Brazilian chocolate truffle made with condensed milk and chocolate powder.
Pão de açúcar is a Brazilian sweet bread roll, often served at breakfast or as a snack.
Moqueca is a Brazilian seafood stew made with fish, coconut milk, peppers, and dendê oil.
Caipirinha is Brazil's national cocktail made with cachaça, sugar, and lime.
Pastel is a Brazilian fried pastry filled with various ingredients like cheese, meat, or palm hearts.
Pudim de leite is a Brazilian milk pudding similar to flan, with caramelized sugar.
Guaraná is a popular Brazilian soft drink made from the guaraná fruit.
Ceviche is a Peruvian dish of fresh raw fish marinated in citrus juices and spiced with chili peppers.
Lomo saltado is a Peruvian stir-fry combining marinated strips of beef with vegetables and french fries.
Inca Kola is a sweet, golden-colored Peruvian soft drink with a bubble gum-like flavor.
Pisco Sour is a Peruvian cocktail made with pisco brandy, lime juice, egg white, and bitters.
Anticuchos are Peruvian grilled beef heart skewers marinated in spices and vinegar.
Ají de gallina is a Peruvian chicken stew in a spicy, creamy yellow pepper sauce.
Papa a la huancaína is a Peruvian appetizer of boiled potatoes with spicy cheese sauce.
Arroz con pollo is a Peruvian rice dish cooked with chicken, cilantro, and spices.
Churros rellenos are Peruvian filled churros with dulce de leche or chocolate.
Chicha morada is a Peruvian beverage made from purple corn, spices, and fruits.
Meat pie is an iconic Australian dish consisting of a flaky pastry filled with minced meat and gravy.
Lamingtons are sponge cakes coated in chocolate and rolled in coconut, a popular Australian dessert.
Vegemite is a thick, dark brown Australian food spread made from leftover brewers' yeast extract.
Barramundi is a popular Australian fish often grilled or pan-fried, served with lemon.
Tim Tams are Australian chocolate biscuits with a chocolate cream filling and coating.
Anzac biscuits are Australian oat cookies traditionally made to send to soldiers overseas.
Kangaroo meat is a lean, gamey Australian protein often grilled or used in stews.
Pavlova is a meringue-based dessert topped with fresh fruit and cream, claimed by both Australia and New Zealand.
Damper is traditional Australian soda bread cooked in a camp oven or on coals.
XXXX is a popular Australian beer brand from Queensland.
Pavlova is a meringue-based dessert topped with fresh fruit and cream, considered a national dish of New Zealand.
Hangi is a traditional Māori method of cooking meat and vegetables in an underground oven.
Fish and chips is popular in New Zealand, often made with blue cod or snapper.
Hokey pokey ice cream is a New Zealand vanilla ice cream with small, solid lumps of honeycomb toffee.
Green-lipped mussels are a New Zealand delicacy often steamed with white wine and garlic.
Kiwi fruit, though originally from China, is strongly associated with New Zealand cuisine.
L&P (Lemon & Paeroa) is a sweet New Zealand soft drink with a lemon flavor.
Whitebait fritters are a New Zealand delicacy made from small, transparent fish.
Afghan biscuits are a New Zealand chocolate cookie topped with a walnut and chocolate icing.
Sauvignon Blanc is New Zealand's signature wine, particularly from the Marlborough region.
